trans-unit.source: Creating an Oracle WebLogic Server 12c Virtual Machine in Azure
trans-unit.target: Creating an Oracle WebLogic Server 12c Virtual Machine in Azure

trans-unit.source: Step through an example of creating an Oracle WebLogic Server 12c virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Step through an example of creating an Oracle WebLogic Server 12c virtual machine running Windows Server 2012 in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows you how you can create a Virtual Machine based on a Microsoft-provided Oracle WebLogic Server 12c image running on Windows Server 2012 in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows you how you can create a Virtual Machine based on a Microsoft-provided Oracle WebLogic Server 12c image running on Windows Server 2012 in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Marketplace, click Compute, then type Oracle into the search box.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Marketplace, click Compute, then type Oracle into the search box.

trans-unit.source: Select the Oracle WebLogic Server 12c Standard Edition on Windows Server 2012 or Oracle WebLogic Server 12c Enterprise Edition on Windows Server 2012 image.
trans-unit.target: Select the Oracle WebLogic Server 12c Standard Edition on Windows Server 2012 or Oracle WebLogic Server 12c Enterprise Edition on Windows Server 2012 image.

trans-unit.source: Review the information about this image (such as minimum recommended size), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Review the information about this image (such as minimum recommended size), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Specify a Host Name for the VM.
trans-unit.target: Specify a Host Name for the VM.

trans-unit.source: Specify a User Name for the VM.
trans-unit.target: Specify a User Name for the VM.

trans-unit.source: Note that this user is for remotely logging into the VM; this is not the Oracle database user name.
trans-unit.target: Note that this user is for remotely logging into the VM; this is not the Oracle database user name.

trans-unit.source: Specify and confirm a password for the VM, or provide a SSH Public Key.
trans-unit.target: Specify and confirm a password for the VM, or provide a SSH Public Key.

trans-unit.source: Choose a Pricing Tier.
trans-unit.target: Choose a Pricing Tier.

trans-unit.source: Note that Recommended Pricing Tiers are displayed by default, to see all configuration options, click View all on the top right.
trans-unit.target: Note that Recommended Pricing Tiers are displayed by default, to see all configuration options, click View all on the top right.

trans-unit.source: Set <linkText>Optional Configuration</linkText><title></title> as needed, with these considerations:
trans-unit.target: Set <linkText>Optional Configuration</linkText><title></title> as needed, with these considerations:

trans-unit.source: Leave Storage Account as-is to create a new storage account with the VM name.
trans-unit.target: Leave Storage Account as-is to create a new storage account with the VM name.

trans-unit.source: Leave Availability Set as “Not Configured”.
trans-unit.target: Leave Availability Set as “Not Configured”.

trans-unit.source: Do not add any endpoints at this time.
trans-unit.target: Do not add any endpoints at this time.

trans-unit.source: Choose or Create a <linkText>Resource Group</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Choose or Create a <linkText>Resource Group</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Choose a Subscription
trans-unit.target: Choose a Subscription

trans-unit.source: Choose a Location
trans-unit.target: Choose a Location

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the Virtual Machine that you want to log in to.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the Virtual Machine that you want to log in to.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: Respond to the prompts as needed to connect to the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Respond to the prompts as needed to connect to the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: When prompted for the administrator name and password, use the values that you provided when you created the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for the administrator name and password, use the values that you provided when you created the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Within the WebLogic Platform QuickStart dialog, click Getting Started with WebLogic Server.
trans-unit.target: Within the WebLogic Platform QuickStart dialog, click Getting Started with WebLogic Server.

trans-unit.source: (If the WebLogic Platform QuickStart dialog is not already opened, open it by clicking Windows Start, typing Start Admin Server for WebLogic Server Domain, and then clicking the Start Admin Server for WebLogic Server Domain icon.)
trans-unit.target: (If the WebLogic Platform QuickStart dialog is not already opened, open it by clicking Windows Start, typing Start Admin Server for WebLogic Server Domain, and then clicking the Start Admin Server for WebLogic Server Domain icon.)

trans-unit.source: In the Welcome dialog, select Create a new WebLogic domain and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Welcome dialog, select Create a new WebLogic domain and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Select Domain Source dialog, accept the default values and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Select Domain Source dialog, accept the default values and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Specify Domain Name and Location dialog, accept the default values and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Specify Domain Name and Location dialog, accept the default values and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Configure Administrator User Name and Password dialog:
trans-unit.target: In the Configure Administrator User Name and Password dialog:

trans-unit.source: [Optional] Change the user name from weblogic to a value of your choosing.
trans-unit.target: [Optional] Change the user name from weblogic to a value of your choosing.

trans-unit.source: Specify and confirm a password for the WebLogic Server administrator.
trans-unit.target: Specify and confirm a password for the WebLogic Server administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Configure Server Start Mode and JDK dialog, select Production Mode, select the available JDK (or browser to a JDK if desired), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Configure Server Start Mode and JDK dialog, select Production Mode, select the available JDK (or browser to a JDK if desired), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Select Optional Configuration dialog, do not select any options, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Select Optional Configuration dialog, do not select any options, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Configuration Summary dialog, click Create.
trans-unit.target: In the Configuration Summary dialog, click Create.

trans-unit.source: In the Creating Domain dialog, check Start Admin Server and then click Done.
trans-unit.target: In the Creating Domain dialog, check Start Admin Server and then click Done.

trans-unit.source: A command prompt for startWebLogic.cmd is started.
trans-unit.target: A command prompt for startWebLogic.cmd is started.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, provide your WebLogic user name and password.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, provide your WebLogic user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Still logged in to your Virtual Machine, copy the shoppingcart.war example available at http://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/tutorials/obe/fmw/wls/12c/12-ManageSessions--4478/files/shoppingcart.war locally.
trans-unit.target: Still logged in to your Virtual Machine, copy the shoppingcart.war example available at http://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/tutorials/obe/fmw/wls/12c/12-ManageSessions--4478/files/shoppingcart.war locally.

trans-unit.source: For example, create a folder named c:\mywar and save the WAR at http://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/tutorials/obe/fmw/wls/12c/12-ManageSessions--4478/files/shoppingcart.war to c:\mywar.
trans-unit.target: For example, create a folder named c:\mywar and save the WAR at http://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/tutorials/obe/fmw/wls/12c/12-ManageSessions--4478/files/shoppingcart.war to c:\mywar.

trans-unit.source: Open the WebLogic Server Administration Console, http://localhost:7001/console.
trans-unit.target: Open the WebLogic Server Administration Console, http://localhost:7001/console.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, provide your WebLogic user name and password.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, provide your WebLogic user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Within the WebLogic Server Administration Console, click Lock & Edit, click Deployments, and then click Install.
trans-unit.target: Within the WebLogic Server Administration Console, click Lock & Edit, click Deployments, and then click Install.

trans-unit.source: For Path, type c:\mywar\shoppingcart.war.
trans-unit.target: For Path, type c:\mywar\shoppingcart.war.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: Select Install this deployment as an application and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select Install this deployment as an application and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Within the WebLogic Server Administration Console, click Save, and then click Activate Changes.
trans-unit.target: Within the WebLogic Server Administration Console, click Save, and then click Activate Changes.

trans-unit.source: Click Deployments, select shoppingcart, click Start, and then click Service All Requests.
trans-unit.target: Click Deployments, select shoppingcart, click Start, and then click Service All Requests.

trans-unit.source: When prompted to confirm, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: When prompted to confirm, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: To see the shopping cart application running locally, open a browser to <http://localhost:7001/shoppingcart>
trans-unit.target: To see the shopping cart application running locally, open a browser to <http://localhost:7001/shoppingcart>

trans-unit.source: Create an endpoint for your Virtual Machine:
trans-unit.target: Create an endpoint for your Virtual Machine:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse
trans-unit.target: Click Browse

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Select the Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Select the Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Click Settings
trans-unit.target: Click Settings

trans-unit.source: Click Endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Click Endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the endpoint
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the endpoint

trans-unit.source: Use TCP for the protocol
trans-unit.target: Use TCP for the protocol

trans-unit.source: Use 80 for the public port
trans-unit.target: Use 80 for the public port

trans-unit.source: Use 7001 for the private port.
trans-unit.target: Use 7001 for the private port.

trans-unit.source: Leave the rest of the options as-is
trans-unit.target: Leave the rest of the options as-is

trans-unit.source: Click OK
trans-unit.target: Click OK

trans-unit.source: Allow an inbound connection through the firewall to port 7001.
trans-unit.target: Allow an inbound connection through the firewall to port 7001.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Click Windows Start, type Windows Firewall with Advanced Security, and then click the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security icon.
trans-unit.target: Click Windows Start, type Windows Firewall with Advanced Security, and then click the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security icon.

trans-unit.source: This opens the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security management console.
trans-unit.target: This opens the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security management console.

trans-unit.source: Within the firewall management console, click Inbound Rules in the left hand pane (if you don’t see Inbound Rules, expand the top node in the left hand pane), and then click New Rule in the right hand pane.
trans-unit.target: Within the firewall management console, click Inbound Rules in the left hand pane (if you don’t see Inbound Rules, expand the top node in the left hand pane), and then click New Rule in the right hand pane.

trans-unit.source: For Rule Type, select Port and click Next.
trans-unit.target: For Rule Type, select Port and click Next.

trans-unit.source: For Protocol and Port, select TCP, select Specific local ports, enter 7001 for the port, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: For Protocol and Port, select TCP, select Specific local ports, enter 7001 for the port, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Select Allow the connection and click Next.
trans-unit.target: Select Allow the connection and click Next.

trans-unit.source: Accept the defaults for the profiles for which the rule applies and click Next.
trans-unit.target: Accept the defaults for the profiles for which the rule applies and click Next.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the rule and optionally a description, and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the rule and optionally a description, and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: To see the shopping cart application running on the Internet, open a browser to the URL in the form of http://<>/shoppingcart. (You can determine the value for <<unique_domain_name>> within the Azure Portal by clicking Virtual Machines and then selecting the Virtual Machine that you are using to run Oracle WebLogic Server).
trans-unit.target: To see the shopping cart application running on the Internet, open a browser to the URL in the form of http://<>/shoppingcart. (You can determine the value for <<unique_domain_name>> within the Azure Portal by clicking Virtual Machines and then selecting the Virtual Machine that you are using to run Oracle WebLogic Server).

trans-unit.source: Now that you’ve set up your Virtual Machine running Oracle WebLogic Server, see the following topics for additional information.
trans-unit.target: Now that you’ve set up your Virtual Machine running Oracle WebLogic Server, see the following topics for additional information.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Oracle Virtual Machine images - Miscellaneous Considerations</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Oracle Virtual Machine images - Miscellaneous Considerations</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Oracle WebLogic Server Product Documentation</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Oracle WebLogic Server Product Documentation</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Oracle WebLogic Server 12c using Linux on Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Oracle WebLogic Server 12c using Linux on Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Oracle Virtual Machine images for Azure</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Oracle Virtual Machine images for Azure</linkText><title></title>
